page.title: 16TRANSPORT IN L.STAUGHTON
page.content: Most families in the village find they have to own at least one car to enable them to travel to work,make major shopping purchases, or visit professional entertainments.The rural {bus}service is very poor with only five buses each weekday and none on Sunday.These buses travel between St.Neots and Bedford.The journey by bus is much slower than by car and takes approximately half an hour to travel ten miles.For elderly people and others without their own transport the{Womens Royal Voluntary Service provides a car for essential journeys to the doctor in Kimbolton. The nearest{Railway Stations}are some 7-ll miles away at St. Neots, Huntingdon and Bedford. Although the nearest{airport}is at Luton, people often fly fron the London airports at Gatwick and Heathrow.
